.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SessionStateModule extends System.Object implements class System.Web.IHttpModule, class System.Web.SessionState.ISessionStateModule
Public NotInheritable Class SessionStateModule Implements ISessionStateModule
type SessionStateModule = class interface ISessionStateModule interface IHttpModule

Docs.summary: Provides session-state services for an application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> is ASP.NET's default session-state handler. It writes session data to and retrieves it from the session-state store and raises the **Session_OnStart** and **Session_OnEnd** events. For details about how to use ASP.NET session state to store and retrieve values for a user session, see [ASP.NET Session State Overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/ms178581(v=vs.100)).
You can replace the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> with a custom implementation of the <xref:System.Web.IHttpModule> interface that manages session state. For an example of a custom session-state module, see the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateUtility> class overview.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is not intended to be called from application code.
An <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object is created when an ASP.NET application is started. The <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object calls the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> constructor to create the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> object for the application. The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> is specified in the configuration for an application.

abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Executes final cleanup code before the object is released from memory.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not intended to be called from application code.
An <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object is created when an ASP.NET application is started. The <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object creates and initializes the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> object for the application and calls the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule.Dispose%2A> method when the object is released. The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> is specified in the configuration for an application.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event End As EventHandler

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule.End> event is raised at the end of a request when the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Abandon%2A> method has been called or when the session has expired. A session expires when the number of minutes specified by the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Timeout%2A> property passes without a request being made for the session.
The **Session_OnEnd** event is used to perform any cleanup work for a session such as disposing of resources used by the session.
You can specify a handler for the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule.End> event by adding a public subroutine named **Session_OnEnd** to the Global.asax file.
> [!NOTE] > The **Session_OnEnd** event is only supported when the session-state <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Mode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property value is <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode.InProc>, which is the default. If the session-state <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Mode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode.StateServer> or <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode.SQLServer>, then the **Session_OnEnd** event in the Global.asax file is ignored. If the session state <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState.Mode%2A> property value is <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateMode.Custom>, then support for the **Session_OnEnd** event is determined by the custom session-state store provider.
Though the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule.End> event is public, you can only handle it by adding an event handler in the Global.asax file. This restriction is implemented because <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> instances are reused for performance. When a session expires, only the **Session_OnEnd** event specified in the Global.asax file is executed, to prevent code from calling an <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule.End> event handler associated with an <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> instance that is currently in use.
For more information about the Global.asax file, see [Global.asax Syntax](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/2027ewzw(v=vs.100)).
## Examples The following code example shows the contents of a Global.asax file with the **Session_OnStart** and **Session_OnEnd** events defined.
```vb <script language="VB" runat="server"> Public Sub Session_OnStart()
End Sub
Public Sub Session_OnEnd()
End Sub </script> ```
```csharp <script language="C#" runat="server"> public void Session_OnStart() {
}
public void Session_OnEnd() {
} </script> ```

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not intended to be called from application code.
An <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> is created when an ASP.NET application is started. The <xref:System.Web.HttpApplication> object calls the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule.Init%2A> method when it creates the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> object for the application. The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule> class is specified in the configuration for an application.
